alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Johnston; Nash; Wake; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 7:26PM EDT until July 06 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Johnston, Nash, Wake and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Bailey, Bunn, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Youngsville, Middlesex, Pilot, Emit, Purnell, Buckhorn Reservoir and Falls Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
